Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> whattomine.com has very fast updates for it's exchange prices, I notice. Discord bots lag and cache things awhile

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> my guess is they are smart, and their backend updates every coin price once per minute(ish) and then the frontend shows whatever latest data the backend tells it. This allows you to be extremely efficient with API requests (rate limiting) and also show users a very recent price

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <ITM> @dukeleto Yes, that great. So the issue with Z-Transaction is pretty huge. A lot of attack vectors. Glad its patched.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <ITM> Thanks duke, The paper really explains a lot. I also found some correct terms they used for my paper. The paper also explains indirectly why a unspent z-chain cannot be link. Hence z-chain - 1.

Author: Gateway#3763

Author: Gateway#3763

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> there was none

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @gigamesh as i described in my blog post, this release of zec is a response to security reports by those 3 people. They gave no details

Author: Gateway#3763

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> The CVE I reported is one flavor of the REJECT attack

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> their paper is larger, describes more things. What I found was just one thing, but a quite important one 🙂

Author: Gateway#3763

Author: Gateway#3763

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @ITM I think it's advantageous for you to use similar terminology as this paper

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> then people will understand and your ideas are more easily accepted

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @ITM also, this is a very good read for you, I promise: https://github.com/BeamMW/beam/wiki/Lelantus-MW

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> MimbleWimble stuff like GRIN/BEAM is not immune to the ITM attack, but everything is slightly different there

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> That is my most recent assesment.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> I am in contact with some GRIN/BEAM researchers and they are interested to see if similar bugs exist in their coins

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @ITM some things we thought of as mitigations and improvements to ITM are baked into MW, and MW also gives some ideas for improvements of your attack/defense strategies

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> it's almost as if @ITM is "read team" and I am "blue team" 😎
